title: User-visible 403 error on paper reviewing timeline
body:
When viewing the paper timeline (as a reviewer) the request that checks for the status of an Editable can return a 403 error which triggers an error dialog.

We probably need to silence 403 errors there as we do with 404 errors ("no editable exists") for this request - while submitters always have access to this particular endpoint, someone who's just a paper reviewer won't (and it's not relevant for them).

title: Wrong users added instead of contributors.
body:
This is a bug that is present for a long time, at least from version 0.98.1, and it is still present in Indico 1.2.1rc2.

The bug shows itself when you try to add a manager that is not a real user, only a contributor.
The contributor id, which is a small number like 0, 1, 2 and so on, is used as a user id.
So usually you end up adding the main administrators or one of the first created users with id 1,2,3
instead of the contributor.

I think the bug is that the search dialog for users offers contributors. Contributors who do not have accounts cannot log into Indico and cannot manage anything, so there si no point in adding them as managers.

The attached screen shots show I  tried to add a contributor named Carretero as a manager, but Martin Kuba (me, the user with id 0) was added instead.

![adding_manager_indico121rc2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10230702/12743106/ba26e070-c98b-11e5-82d1-c514bb685a0c.png)
![added_manager_indico121rc2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10230702/12743108/bf998ec2-c98b-11e5-8e37-a444ce55cb20.png)

title: Ambiguous "Email" action
body:
**Describe the bug**
The first entry in the 'Actions' menu in the 'Registration' page is labelled 'Email' while it's used to send email to participants. As far as I can say, even if the context helps, this is a bit weird in English.

However, it's really weird in French (I mainly use this language) where it says "Adresse électronique", literally "email address" (singular). According to my Italian and Spanish colleagues, the respective translation in those languages are weird too.

Note that this is not just a purist issue: this weird phrasing makes hard to find the feature.

I have attached screenshots for those languages (and suggestions below).

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'Registration'
2. Click on a registration list
3. Select one or more participants
4. Click on 'Actions'
5. See the first entry

**Expected behavior**

From my understanding and discussion with my colleagues, I would say:
- in English: "Send email"
- in French: "Envoyer un courrier électronique" (to stay coherent with other usages)
- in Italian: "Inviare une email"
- in Spanish: "Enviar un correo electrónico"

Other entries in the 'Action' menu have similar structure.

**Screenshots**

English:
![en](https://github.com/indico/indico/assets/4348913/ac3537d3-22cb-4e99-8e25-57786cce8cf2)

French:
![fr](https://github.com/indico/indico/assets/4348913/75d2e99d-0303-45e7-b38e-c0a84cd660b5)

Italian:
![it](https://github.com/indico/indico/assets/4348913/0ca706d7-3443-4a0b-adad-04945fb722f9)

Spanish:
![es](https://github.com/indico/indico/assets/4348913/11c6943b-ca4d-4cb1-a1a2-e2d6380af03c)

**Additional context**

I don't know much about translations but AFAIK this entry use the "Email" message which is used in several files. Maybe we need to differentiate the email address and the action of sending an email.

Note that there is a "Send emails" message which is almost what we need.

title: Plugin badges broken if there's a long word in the plugin name
body:
E.g. a plugin named "Webcast/Recording Request". "Webcast/Recording" is considered one word so it's not wrapped.

One solution would be using `text-overflow: ellipsis` and showing the full title in a tooltip. Another one would be using `word-wrap: break-word` but that looks quite ugly since there's no hyphenation.

title: [A11Y] Timezone list markup improvements
body:
**Describe the bug**

Timezone selector's behavior currently suffers from several issues related to keyboard interaction. It could also use some UX improvements as well.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

Scenario A:

1. Go to any page which has a time zone selector
2. Focus the timezone button using a keyboard
3. Open the timezone popup by pressing Enter/Return or Spacebar
4. Try to navigate into the timezone popup
5. Observe that navigation "skips" the timezone popup

Scenario B:

1. Click at the top of the timezone popup so that further keyboard navigation will start from the top of the popup
2. Focus the radios
3. Select the "Specify a timezone" radio
4. Observe that the focus is automatically moved to the select list below

**Expected behavior**

When the popup is expanded, the keyboard focus should move to the popup *when the user presses Tab key* (not automatically).

When the "Specify a timezone" radio is selected, focus should *not* automatically move to the select list.

There are also several issues with the semantics of the markup which I will address in a patch for this issue.

**Additional context**

- https://talk.getindico.io/t/keyboard-navigation-session-bar-timezone-picker/3197/3
- https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/keyboard.html

title: Allow file naming when download materials

milestone.title: v2.2
milestone.description: A rewrite of the Room Booking Module UI, which will allow us to stop depending on Mako and remove a good amount of legacy JS code. We'll be introducing React, Redux and Semantic UI React.

body:
``` yaml
# Ticket imported from Trac
```

When uploading slides to an Indico agenda via the "Manage Material" option, it is possible in the Advanced tab to set the display name. However this is ignored when the file is downloaded.

What I would like is to be able to have my own personal convention for naming my slides, but to be able to specify how they should be named when downloaded by someone else for a particular meeting. For example, my talks may have some cryptic meeting name and date in the filenames, but someone downloading all files for a meeting may prefer a more obvious name for them, eg just my name.

So I would like to suggest that the display name set in the advanced tab should also be the downloaded filename.

This used to be possible in the old version of Indico but is still not supported by the new version (despite a previous request).

title: Room administration: "notification_emails" field is often shown empty even if mails are set
body:
**Describe the bug**
After entering and saving mail addresses in the field `notification_emails` in the room booking administration when editing a room's details (on the page "Notifications", labelled "Notification emails"), the field is often shown as "empty" (i.e. with the standard placeholder text) when entering the same menu again. Opening the page up many times, sometimes the actual content is shown. 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to "Room Booking", enter "Administration" via the hamburger menu, then click on a location and edit a room via the pen. 
2. Click on "Notifications". 
3. Enter a mail address in the field "Notification emails" and save it. 
4. Completely refresh the page / re-enter room booking administration, i.e. repeat step 1. 
5. Click on "Notifications" again. 
6. The field is shown empty, in about 1 out of 5 attempts. 

**Expected behavior**
Field content to be shown every time. 

**Additional context**
Tested with Firefox 111.0 on Linux, colleagues using Firefox can also reproduce it. 
Testing with Google Chrome 112 on Linux, the chance to see the content of the field seems higher (about 4 in 5 times, the content is visible). 

Checking with web developer tools, the JSON response always contains the field content, so this is likely something furhter down the road, i.e. some kind of race condition in Javascript? 

Note: This is with Indico v3.2.3.

title: Date Field in Registration Form Only Shows Previous and Next 5 years
body:
When trying to use Date field in a registration form for date of birth, users are only able to choose from the previous or next 5 years.

Some people think that you cannot put a date below 2019... which is complicated for a date a birth.

Of course, when you type the date it works. 

Is this normal behaviour or should the list of years be scrollable ?

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a new registration form
2. Add a Date field
3. Try to complete the registration form as a user
4. See problem

title: Room Booking: Visual feedback for moderated rooms on list of rooms
body:
``` yaml
# Ticket imported from Trac
```

In previous versions of room listings we had three different kinds of rooms:
- Basic room: everybody can book
- Private room: restricted group can book
- Moderated room: booking requires confirmation from a room manager

In the current version there is no way to tell if the room is moderated (PRE-bookable only).

It should be rather easy to add an icon with a qtip indicating this fact. Even a more polished solution is adding this information as an attribute like ''"Video conference available"\* or *"private"'', so moderated rooms can also be filtered.

title: Migration from from 2.2.4 to 3.3.4 -> HTML formatting issues
body: **Describe the bug** I successfully migrated an Indico 2.2.4 instance to a freshly installed Indico 3.3.4 by creating a PostreSQL dump and restoring them on a clean instance. The only problem I have observed (so far) is that the HTML formatting is incorrect. Apparently, HTML code inside descriptions is escape, which results in HTML-comments showing up in visible text. See screenshots below. What is the proper way to migrate these? **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: Create database dump with `pg_dump -F c indico > indico.dump` from Indico 2.2.4 with PostgreSQL 9.6.24 Transfer the `archive/` folder to the new instance (irrelevant for this issue) Restore the database using `pg_restore -U indico -C -d postgres indico.dump`, which showed some errors but those were "ignored" ``` root@69d6c701fbad:/# pg_restore -U indico -C -d postgres indico.dump pg_restore: error: could not execute query: ERROR: schema "public" already exists Command was: CREATE SCHEMA public; pg_restore: error: could not execute query: ERROR: role "postgres" does not exist Command was: ALTER SCHEMA public OWNER TO postgres; pg_restore: warning: errors ignored on restore: 2 ``` Run `indico db upgrade` and `indico db --all-plugins upgrade` -> both were running fine ``` (.venv) indico@a129602bf89d:~$ indico db upgrade Fontconfig error: No writable cache directories Fontconfig error: No writable cache directories ... title: `moment()` sometimes uses an instance with no locale configured
body:
This happens e.g. in the event cloning dialog when previewing the dates on which the cloned events will take place when cloning with a pattern. Since it uses the default `en` locale it's using `mm/dd/yyyy` format instead of `dd/mm/yyyy` or whatever the locale uses.

`window.moment !== moment` in there, and when checking with the browser's dev tools the non-global moment is coming from another scope, so it's most likely caused by the webpack ProvidesPlugin we're using:

```js
      new webpack.ProvidePlugin({
        _: ['underscore', 'default'],
        moment: 'moment',
      }),
```

**Describe the bug**

The "Skip access checks" checkbox cannot be reached by tab navigation.

title: Non bookable periods are not displayed nor checked on the view
body:
Non bookable periods are similar to blockings as they prevent reservations to be created. However, we don't display them in any calendar view nor do any check for them during the reservation workflow. This leads to people trying to book rooms that are not bookable and then getting an error in the last step because no occurrences could be created for that day without giving any particular reason as to why.

We should:
- [x] Add visual feedback in the calendar view (similar to blockings maybe?)
- [x] Prevent people to go past the second step of the reservation workflow
## Screenshots

The room is unavailable for that day but it show up normally. The green bar can be clicked and brings you to the next page. 

![screenshot from 2015-01-13 10 44 15](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/716307/5718797/da52b4a4-9b11-11e4-8b82-e8f0e8de1988.png)

On the next page, one can try to pre/book and the error dialog pops up when the server creates no occurrences for the reservation.

![unnamed](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/716307/5718807/fc11abcc-9b11-11e4-85a1-5469314f35c2.png)

``` yaml
# Ticket imported from Trac
```

The option titled "Participation requests must be approved by the event managers (you)" in the tab "Setup" of "Participants" in event management is always displayed as green on page reload, regardless of its actual setting. 

The problem is cause by a missing "p" in "autopAccept" in file MaKaC/webinterface/tpls/ConferenceParticipantsSetup.tpl on the line that looks like

```
$("#inPlaceEditAutoAccept").append($(new RemoteSwitchButton(${"false" if autoAccept else "true"},
```

The name of the variable should be **autopAccept** instead of **autoAccept**.

The bug was spotted in Indico 0.98.1, but is still present in the latest source in the moment of reporting.

conferenceCreation.py?categId=0&event_type=simple_event

It says:

```
"The lecture will take place in NNN date(s) "
```

This is very confusing, since use of the preposition "in" makes it look like it is asking if the lecture will take place tomorrow, or the next day, etc. But actually it is asking for the number of days the lecture will be held (which, by the way, makes no sense because then it is multiple lectures, not one lecture).

Anyway, I suggest the following:

1) At the very least, change the text as follows:

```
The lecture(s) take place on NNN distinct days
(if only one lecture, leave the default value of 1)
```

better yet...

2) By default, only display the single calendar entry. Then have a button for "click here to create a multi-part lecture spread over multiple days"

even better...

3) If the "lecture" actually consists of three separate parts, then people should not be allowed to use this page to create it! They should create a meeting instead. It makes no sense do allow the lecture creation page to create three separate conference IDs, especially since Indico does not know that they have anything to do with each other, other than the very klugey method of using URLs attached as content to link them together. When people search for the 3-day lecture they will not necessarily find all three days.

title: "Copy link" doesn't work after uploading an image
body:
When uploading images via the event image uploader we reload the image list with AJAX. The clipboard JS only runs once on dom ready though so clicking the link button will just open the image instead of copying the link to the clipboard.

Possible solutions:
- trigger indico:htmlUpdated and listen to that event in the clipboard code and apply the clipboard logic on elements where that event is triggered
- check whether we can tell the clipboard library to create a delegate on the document itself so it works with new elements. (maybe ask the developer of it in a github issue in their repo)

When two users have identical e-mail addresses (maybe it is necessary that they have also identical last/first name, I did not check), then only one of them is displayed when searching on
 https://www.cta-observatory.org/indico/userList.py?sSurName=cheikh
(or equivalent) and other search dialogs in InDiCo.

That should (and hopefuly can) be changed rapidly.

While it is correct that new users cannot "reuse" an existing e-mail address, they may change their address afterwards. Thus it may happen that inactive accounts are displayed, while active accounts are "hidden" by the system. A merge (over HTTP) needs a working search, so it is not possible any more. Merge with indico_shell also works fine. But better fix the problem in the search result display.

title: Paragraphs in editors are missing spacing
body:
**Describe the bug**
When you write something in a ck editor, e.g. conference description, there is no visible difference between a line break and a paragraph. When you view it in the result, there is however. This is mildly confusing.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create an event with a description. Add some text, a few line breaks, a paragraph
2. Save the description
3. Compare what you see in the editor with the final result

**Expected behavior**
Paragraph spacing in the editor

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/607198/212900832-c2785c21-4a3d-4a0b-a97a-f0d5c65aa01b.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/607198/212900867-17544fdb-6080-4a45-8589-67407d1b5921.png)

**Additional context**
This apparently goes back to this change https://github.com/indico/indico/commit/1541785758f00be132caaa1bfa53a6d85a3e9045 for IE, which I guess we could revert? At the very least, removing that CSS rule will make it default to semantic-ui's 1em margin-bottom.

title: Using "Import" feature silently fails to fetch event information for unlisted events
body:
**Describe the bug**
Creating an event and trying to "Import" parts of an unlisted events by pasting the URL of the unlisted event does not show any UI response (i.e. event is not "shown" / no error is shown, can not proceed). 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create an unlisted event with some content, e.g. registration forms, which you want to import into another event. 
2. Enter the event you want to import data into, click on the cog-wheel, then choose "Import". 
3. Paste the URL from the unlisted event. 
4. No event shown / can not proceed (also, no error shown). If there already was an error message present e.g. from a previously entered URL, it remains there. 

**Expected behavior**
Either an error message should be shown (i.e. "can not import from unlisted events"), or the unlisted event should be found correctly and it should be possible to import from it. 

**Screenshots**
![grafik](https://github.com/indico/indico/assets/166759/418ca52f-d719-4a3f-80c9-1b4b0d1a8579)

**Additional context**
Listing the unlisted event, without any further changes, the import functionality starts to work.

title: Link leading to nonexistent page in indico/web/templates/forms/markdown_widget.html
body:
**Describe the bug**
When submitting new abstract, the user is shown a hint that "You can use Markdown and LaTeX math formulae." And the LaTeX link points to a nonexistent page, because the MathJax documentation evolved and now the page doesn't exist.

The nonexistent link is in `indico/web/templates/forms/markdown_widget.html` points to `https://docs.mathjax.org/en/latest/tex.html#supported-latex-commands` – but it should point to `https://docs.mathjax.org/en/latest/input/tex/macros/index.html` or more generally to `https://docs.mathjax.org/en/latest/input/tex/index.html`.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Open abstract submission workflow
2. On the right of the Abstract submission workflow there is an info icon - when you click on it, a hit appears with two links.
3. Click on the LaTeX link
4. See the message about non-existent link appear.

**Expected behavior**
A link should point to a HTML page that exists.

**Additional context**
MathJax documentantion has been restructured and now the link should point elsewhere.

title: Meeting pages look funny
body:
`{% set previous_date = date %}` at the end of a loop to check whether the value changed since the last iteration only worked because of a jinja bug (cross-loop sets were never supposed to work), which has been fixed in Jinja 2.9.

There are currently various workarounds that are more or less ugly (mutable objects with the `do` extension, or the groupby filter), but possibly there will be a clean solution to access the previous loop item in Jinja until 1.9.10 is ready for production.

Related jinja issue: pallets/jinja#641

![funny](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/179599/22471432/98887486-e7d2-11e6-9d22-dfec085849ca.png)

title: Translation of "Select a category" dialog (missing "{0} categories" string from Transifex)
body:
In the "Select a category" dialog (e.g. "Create meeting" from the menu -> press "Choose category" button) the popup text, which appears when a mouse pointer is hovered over the number of categories and events on the right hand side of each row in the dialog, is **partially translated**. The text is "{0} categories | {0} events" with numbers inserted instead of "{0}" and single or plural form of the word "category"/"event" used.

The problem is that the "{0} events" part of that string is properly translated, while the "{0} categories" always stays in English.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to "Create meeting" in the main menu
2. Click on "Choose category" button
3. Hover mouse pointer over the numbers on the right hand side of any row in the dialog
4. See mixed-language text in the popup (see the screenshot for reference)

Or just search for `"{0} categories"` on Transifex and see that it is missing.

**Expected behavior**
The text of the popup should be fully translated.

**Screenshots**
German translation is used because on Transifex it is 100% translated, so no English words should be present (in theory)
![2024-12-01_21-33-52](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a75c2da9-ed9c-4b33-8d3a-22f4dc606486)

**Additional context**
 I assume that the code is located here: [indico/web/client/js/jquery/widgets/categorynavigator.js](https://github.com/indico/indico/blob/4fa81c297f4c08d5b842e420a26125627c5bc4cd/indico/web/client/js/jquery/widgets/categorynavigator.js#L300). So the issue might be with `indico/web/client/js/jquery/widgets/categorynavigator.js` missing from Transifex. The "{0} events" substring is present in Transifex as it appears also in `indico/modules/categories/client/js/display.js`, but the "{0} categories" substring seems to be unique to `categorynavigator.js`.

``` yaml
# Ticket imported from Trac
# Reported by: dmartinc
# Originally assigned to: dmartinc
```

This is an error message sent by the EVO server that occurs if we try to create / modify an EVO booking so that the end date is before the start.
It is not being captured because normally the error checks should not allow such a request to be sent to EVO.
However this can happen if a booking is synchronized to an event and a special case of date changes happen.
We should therefore capture it in order to avoid an exception mail and show a fail reason to the user. Right now the user is correctly notified that a synchronized move changed but does not know the reason.

When a popup window is opened, if the mouse's cursor is not set and the user click on the backspace key, the page will go back, two different ways have been observed:
1. The popup closes and you go back to the previous page.
2. The popup window stay there, but "behind" it, the page goes back (This is the most critical because once the user close the popup, he's lost)

Should find a way to not be able to go backward when a popup window is opened. Maybe by setting the focus on the first field.
